snippet: For Yankees pitcher Hiroki Kuroda, the hardships he endured playing baseball in Japan almost drove him out of the game, but it may have ultimately helped him surpass expectations.
abstract: Profile of New York Yankees pitcher Hiroki Kuroda, who is among the last of a cohort of Japanese baseball players who grew up in a culture in which staggeringly long work days and severe punishment were normal; the hardships Kuroda almost drove him out of baseball, but it ultimately fueled his desire to perform well.
lead_paragraph: For Yankees pitcher Hiroki Kuroda, the hardships he endured playing baseball in Japan almost drove him out of the game, but it may have ultimately helped him surpass expectations.

headline.seo: In Japan, Yankees’ Kuroda Was Molded by Pain
headline.main: Yankees’ Kuroda Was Molded by Pain in Japan
headline.print_headline: Tempered In Fire, Molded By Pain
